Package org.efs.timer

package org.efs.timer
efs provides a high precision timer via EfsScheduledExecutor which provides a similar functionality as ScheduledExecutorService with the difference that expired timer tasks are dispatched to an efs agent's event queue. This means timer events are processed on a efs dispatcher thread which means the efs agent remains effectively single threaded.

Scheduling Timers

EfsScheduledExecutor provides timer scheduling methods similar to ScheduledExecutorService:

  • EfScheduledExecutor.schedule(String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration delay)
  • EfsScheduledExecutor.scheduleAtFixedRate(String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration initialDelay, Duration period)
  • EfsScheduledExecutor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration initialDelay, Duration delay)

The main difference between Java and efs schedulers is that efs requires an IEfsAgent argument and does not support scheduling a Callable.

Creating efs Scheduled Executors

EfsScheduledExecutor class documentation provides detailed description on how to create a new efs scheduled executor. Like efs dispatcher threads, efs schedulers come in four flavor: blocking, spinning, spin+park, and spin+yield.

Note: a default efs scheduled executor is not provided.

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.efs.timer.config
    Contains classes used to define EfsScheduledExecutors.
  • Class
    Description
    EfsScheduledExecutor
    Executes given timer, IEfsAgent pairs at a specified time.
    EfsScheduledExecutor.Builder
    Builder for constructing EfsDispatcher instance.
    EfsScheduledExecutor.CancelReason
    Provides reason for a timer no longer running.
    EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer
    A scheduled timer task which may be active, expired, or canceled.
    EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerState
    An efs-scheduled timer may be in one of three states: waiting for an active timer to expire, timer has expired and is no longer active, and timer is canceled, will never expire, and is no longer active.
    EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerType
    Enumerates supported timer type: single shot, repeated at a fixed rate, and repeated at a fixed delay.
    EfsTimerEvent
    Event reporting a timer expiration.
